title: Requires establishment of model community programs
summary: Requires establishment of model community programs, including a model telephone reassurance program and a model visiting program for elders.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1702

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. DINOWITZ, ROBINSON, LUPARDO -- Multi-Sponsored by
         -- M. of A. BARRON -- read once and referred to the Committee on Aging

       AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to requiring establishment of
         model  community  programs for local agencies, including a model tele-
         phone reassurance program and a model visiting program for elders

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The elder law is amended by adding a new section 203-a to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S 203-A. MODEL COMMUNITY PROGRAMS. IN ORDER TO ENCOURAGE THE  DEVELOP-
    4  MENT  OF  ACTIVITIES  AND  PROGRAMS  THAT  PROMOTE AGING WITH DIGNITY IN
    5  COMMUNITIES, THE OFFICE SHALL DEVELOP MODEL  COMMUNITY  PROGRAMS  TO  BE
    6  DISTRIBUTED  UPON  REQUEST TO LOCAL AREA AGENCIES ON AGING AND COMMUNITY
    7  BASED ORGANIZATIONS. SUCH MODEL COMMUNITY  PROGRAMS  SHALL  INCLUDE  THE
    8  FOLLOWING:
    9    1. A MODEL TELEPHONE REASSURANCE PROGRAM SHALL BE DEVELOPED TO PROVIDE
   10  FOR THE FOLLOWING:
   11    (A) PHONE CALLS BY THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINING THE PROGRAM TO PARTIC-
   12  IPATING SENIORS AT AN AGREED UPON TIME EACH DAY;
   13    (B)  A  SECONDARY  CONTACT,  WHERE  APPLICABLE, TO BE CONTACTED IF THE
   14  SENIOR DOES NOT ANSWER THE INITIAL CALL AND BEFORE LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT
   15  ARE CONTACTED;
   16    (C) COORDINATION WITH LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT TO ENSURE  AN  APPROPRIATE
   17  RESPONSE IN THE EVENT THE SENIOR CANNOT BE CONTACTED;
   18    (D)  ADVANCE CONSENT TO ACCESS TO THE HOME BY LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT TO
   19  DETERMINE THE STATUS OF THE SENIOR IF CONTACT WITH THE SENIOR COULD  NOT
   20  BE MADE; AND
   21    (E)  INCREASED  COORDINATION BETWEEN THE SENIORS UTILIZING THE PROGRAM
   22  AND PROGRAM OPERATORS TO REDUCE INCIDENTS RESULTING IN  UNNECESSARY  LAW
   23  ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04508-01-1

       A. 1702                             2

    1    2. A MODEL VISITING PROGRAM SHALL BE DEVELOPED TO PROVIDE SENIORS WITH
    2  A VISITOR WHO CAN OFFER CONTACT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND COMPANIONSHIP FOR
    3  SENIORS  WHO  LACK A NETWORK OF FAMILY AND FRIENDS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.
    4  THE MODEL VISITING PROGRAM SHALL INCLUDE:
    5    (A)  METHODS  TO  OBTAIN VOLUNTEERS INCLUDING BY PARTNERING WITH LOCAL
    6  EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS;
    7    (B) SYSTEMS TO SCREEN VOLUNTEERS TO  BOTH  ENSURE  A  GOOD  MATCH  AND
    8  PROTECT SENIORS INVOLVED IN THE PROGRAM;
    9    (C)  SYSTEMS TO PERIODICALLY CHECK ON BOTH VOLUNTEERS AND THE SENIORS;
   10  AND
   11    (D) RESPONSES TO PROBLEMS THAT MAY ARISE.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to requiring establishment of model community programs for local agencies, including a model telephone reassurance program and a model visiting program for elders
